comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: HMS Empress of India (1891) was sunk by the Royal Navy as a target ship in November 1913.

comment.author: 91178396@N00
comment._content:
Well it was all of sixty-five years ago
When the world was the street where she lived
And a young man sailed on a ship in the sea
With a picture of Veronica

On the "Empress of India" and as she closed her eyes upon the world
And picked upon the bones of last week's news
She spoke his name out loud again

-Elvis Costello, "Veronica"

comment.author: 7420176@N08
comment._content: After seeing it, I can see why they might have sunk their own ship. The the proudest of achievements from a naval architecture perspective.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: completed in 1893, she was typical of the rapid evolution of battleships during this time, all of which were made obsolete when Dreadnought came along in 1906.  She has an unusual side by side funnel arrangement.  Her wreck is diveable by advanced divers.
